LONDON MARKET PRE-OPEN: Non-Standard Finance Deal For Provident Off
LONDON MARKET PRE-OPEN: Non-Standard Finance Deal For Provident Off
Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
June 5, 2019 Wednesday 2:46 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 981 words
Body
 Stock prices in London are set to open higher on Wednesday, following onfrom sharp gains seen on Wall Street 
after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell suggested the US central bank could lower interest rates.
In London, Non-Standard Finance's hostile takeover of larger doorstep lending rival Provident Financial lapsed. 
FTSE 100-listed Aviva's chief financial officer has decided to step down, while Workspace reported a sharp rise in 
rental income. 
IG futures indicate the FTSE 100 is set to open 7.01 points higher at 7,221.30. The blue chip index closed up 29.49 
points, or 0.4%, at 7,214.29 on Tuesday.
Non-Standard Finance's hostile GBP1.1 billion takeover for Provident Financial collapsed after the UK financial 
regulator blocked the deal on Tuesday.
Non-Standard Finance said it would "lapse" the offer following discussions with regulatory authorities as it had 
received a low level of acceptances by Wednesday deadline to declare the offer bid wholly unconditional. As at 
Wednesday, Non-Standard Finance had received acceptances from around 54% of Provident investors. 
Non-Standard Finance explained that while it remains appropriately capitalised, due to the low level of acceptances 
received, "the enlarged Non-Standard Finance group would not have sufficient regulatory capital on a consolidated 
basis at completion due to the expected level of minority interests at that point".
John van Kuffeler, Non-Standard Finance's group chief executive said: "I am very disappointed that despite our 
best efforts customers, employees and shareholders will not now benefit from our transformation plan to build a 
brighter future by combining Provident with Non-Standard Finance."
Aviva said CFO Tom Stoddard will be stepping down at the end of June. Aviva said Stoddard will remain with the 
company until the end of 2019 to "support an orderly transition". 
Current Aviva UK Insurance CFO Jason Windsor has been appointed interim CFO for the group.
LONDON MARKET PRE-OPEN: Non-Standard Finance Deal For Provident Off
Ryanair said its May traffic was up 13% year-on-year to 14.1 million customers. The budget airline operated 78,000 
scheduled flights in May. 
Office space rental firm Workspace saw a sharp fall in pretax profit in financial 2019 due to a lower year-on-year 
valuation increase and lower disposals profits compared to the year before. 
In the twelve months to March 31, Workspace reported pretax profit of GBP137.3 million, down from GBP170.4 
million. The company's trading profit increased 19%, however, to GBP72.4 million.
Workspace hiked its full year dividend 20% to 32.87 pence.
Card Factory said its first-quarter total sales were up 6.4% on a year before, with like-for-like sales in the three 
months to April 30 up 2.3%.
Card Factory said its performance in the first quarter "represents an encouraging start to the year". The company's 
expectations for the full year remain unchanged.
Go-Ahead said it has appointed Elodie Brian as chief financial officer on a permanent basis. Brian has been the 
firm's interim CFO since December. 
Speaking at the motoring association's AGM, AA said its trading in the period is in line with expectations and 
remains "well positioned" to meet its medium-term growth targets to financial 2023. AA also said it is "well 
positioned" to see Ebitda growth in financial 2020.
AA's financial year ends January 31.
Fed Chair Powell pledged the central bank will take appropriate actions to sustain the US economic expansion. 
Powell mentioned recent developments involving trade negotiations and other matters in opening remarks at a 
Chicago Fed conference on Tuesday, acknowledging that the Fed does not know how or when these issues will be 
resolved.
"We are closely monitoring the implications of these developments for the US economic outlook and, as always, we 
will act as appropriate to sustain the expansion, with a strong labor market and inflation near our symmetric 2% 
objective," Powell said.
The rest of Powell's speech focused on longer-run issues, but the Fed chief's initial comments generated optimism 
about a potential interest rate cut and spurred a rally on Wall Street.
Powell's comments come after St Louis Fed President James Bullard suggested in a speech on Monday that an 
interest rate cut "may be warranted soon" due in part to escalating global trade tensions.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average ending up 2.1%, the S&P 500 up 2.1% and Nasdaq Composite up 2.7%.
In Asia on Wednesday, the Japanese Nikkei 225 closed up 1.8%. In China, the Shanghai Composite is up 0.1%, 
and the Hang Seng index in Hong Kong is up 0.5%.
Sterling was quoted at USD1.2706 early Wednesday, higher than USD1.2675 at the London equities close on 
Wednesday.
US President Donald Trump on Tuesday promised a "phenomenal" trade deal between the UK and US on his 
second day of a three-day state visit to the UK. "As the UK makes preparations to exit the EU, the US is committed 
to a phenomenal trade deal between the US and the UK," Trump said. "There is tremendous potential in that trade 
deal, I say probably two and even three times what we're doing right now."
The economic events calendar on Wednesday has Markit services PMI readings from France, Germany, the 
Eurozone and the UK at 0850 BST, 0855 BST, 0900 BST and 0930 BST, respectively.
LONDON MARKET PRE-OPEN: Non-Standard Finance Deal For Provident Off
Later in the day, there is Eurozone producer price index at 1000 BST and US Markit PMI reading at 1445 BST.
Already out, China's private sector activity growth moderated to a three-month low in May partly driven by softer 
rise in services activity, survey results published by IHS Markit revealed.
The Caixin composite output index fell to 51.5 in May from 52.7 in April. Nonetheless, the score remained above 
50.0 for the thirty-ninth consecutive month, suggesting continuing expansion in the sector.
The services Purchasing Managers' Index dropped to a 3-month low of 52.7 in May from 54.5 in April. However, the 
score was consistent with a robust rise in output amid firm client demand.

Canaccord Genuity Lowers Ryanair (RYAAY) to Hold
Canaccord Genuity Lowers Ryanair (RYAAY) to Hold
DailyPolitical
June 5, 2019 Wednesday 12:07 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 695 words
Body
Jun 05, 2019( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) was 
downgraded by analysts at Canaccord Genuity from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating in a report released on 
Wednesday, Briefing.com Automated Import[1] reports.Several other equities research analysts have also recently 
issued reports on RYAAY. Cantor Fitzgerald raised Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on 
Wednesday, February 6th. Societe Generale raised Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on 
Tuesday, February 19th. 
HSBC cut Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "reduce" rating in a report on Wednesday, May 22nd. BidaskClub cut 
Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Wednesday, May 8th. Finally, Raymond James reduced 
their target price on Ryanair from $85.00 to $80.00 and set an "outperform" rating on the stock in a report on 
Tuesday, May 21st. Five equities research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, six have assigned a hold 
rating and six have issued a buy rating to the company's stock. Ryanair presently has a consensus rating of "Hold" 
and a consensus price target of $76.33.Shares of Ryanair stock[2] opened at $67.50 on Wednesday. Ryanair has a 
52 week low of $65.14 and a 52 week high of $120.86. The stock has a market capitalization of $15.37 billion, a PE 
ratio of 13.13 and a beta of 0.85. The company has a current ratio of 0.93, a quick ratio of 0.93 and a debt-to-equity 
ratio of 0.64. Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, May 20th. The 
transportation company reported ($0.74) EPS for the quarter, missing the Thomson Reuters' consensus estimate of 
($0.64) by ($0.10). Ryanair had a net margin of 11.69% and a return on equity of 20.34%. The business had 
revenue of $1.45 billion during the quarter. On average, equities research analysts anticipate that Ryanair will post 
4.55 EPS for the current fiscal year. A number of hedge funds and other institutional investors have recently 
modified their holdings of RYAAY. Harris Associates L P increased its stake in Ryanair by 38.6% during the fourth 
quarter. Harris Associates L P now owns 14,358,251 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$1,024,318,000 after acquiring an additional 4,002,188 shares during the last quarter. Lazard Asset Management 
LLC increased its stake in Ryanair by 39.6% during the first quarter. Lazard Asset Management LLC now owns 
6,533,662 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $489,632,000 after acquiring an additional 1,854,616 
shares during the last quarter. Baillie Gifford .... increased its stake in Ryanair by 15.7% during the fourth quarter. 
Baillie Gifford .... now owns 6,792,319 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $484,564,000 after 
acquiring an additional 920,644 shares during the last quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA increased 
its stake in Ryanair by 27.5% during the fourth quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA now owns 
3,458,575 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $246,734,000 after acquiring an additional 745,493 
shares during the last quarter. Finally, Marshall Wace LLP bought a new stake in Ryanair during the first quarter 
worth approximately $40,951,000. 43.06% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors. Ryanair

European ADRs Move Higher in Tuesday Trading
European ADRs Move Higher in Tuesday Trading
MT Newswires Live Briefs
June 4, 2019 Tuesday 10:42 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 210 words
Body
 American depositary receipts of European stocks were trading 1.71% higher at 1,016.88 on the BNY Mellon 
Europe Select ADR Index on Tuesday.
In continental Europe, the gainers were led by biotech firm Forward Pharma (FWP), which climbed 7.3%. Also 
rising were telecommunications opertor Telecom Italia (TI) and Aegon (AEG), which rose 4.1% and 4.0%.
The decliners in continental Europe were led by pharmaceutical companies Oasmia Pharmaceutical (OASM) and 
Ascendis Pharma (ASND), which fell 6.7% and 2% respectively. They were followed by 3D printer company voxeljet 
(VJET) and biopharmaceutical firm argenx (ARGX), which dropped 1.2% and 1%.
In the UK and Ireland, the gainers were led by pharmaceutical firm Avadel (AVDL) and Royal Bank of Scotland 
(RBS), which rose 3.9% and 3.5% respectively. They were followed by telecommunications operator BT Group (BT) 
and airline Ryanair (RYAAY), which were up 3.2% and 3.1%.
The decliners in the UK and Ireland were led by biotech firm Autolus Therapeutics (AUTL) and software firm 
Endava (DAVA), which fell 6.2% and 4.5% respectively. They were followed educational publisher Pearson (PSO) 
and analytics and information provider RELX PLC (RELX), which lost 1.4% and 1.1%.
Price: 1.01, Change: +0.07, Percent Change: +7.33
Load-Date: June 5, 2019
End of Document
Flight Attendant Spills Hot Water On Airline Passenger, Causes Blisters, Burns
Flight Attendant Spills Hot Water On Airline Passenger, Causes Blisters, 
Burns
International Business Times News
June 4, 2019 Tuesday 9:51 AM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 469 words
Body
Jun 04, 2019( International Business Times News: http://www.ibtimes.com Delivered by Newstex)  A Ryanair 
passenger claimed that her partner was left with serious burns and blisters after anattendant accidentally spilled 
scalding hot water on him on a flight from Faro, Portugal, to Glasgow, Scotland. Although the incident took place on 
May 20, Tonina Ciantar only recently opened up about the ordeal that her partner, Thomas McNab, 49, had to go 
through."We had ordered two paninis and two hot chocolates shortly after take-off. 
The air hostess had the trolley next to Thomas and, next thing I knew, he jumped up and was screaming he was 
burning. About four of five cups were scattered on the floor and he was screaming that boiling water had gone down 
the front of his trousers and on to his feet. He stood up and ran to the bathroom to get the shoes off and try and get 
some cold water on them,' Ciantar said, Daily Record reported[1].She added that after the accidental spill, the flight 
attendant failed to administer the necessary first aid, and a result, the blisters and burns that her partner suffered 
just got worse. At one point, he even went into shock.'The flight attendant didn't even offer to get emergency 
assistance or move our seat so Thomas could stretch his legs out,' Ciantar said. "She actually made a comment 
about Thomas causing himself embarrassment by getting an ambulance. At one point he started shivering and 
saying he was cold. I panicked and bought some chocolate for him to try and boost his blood sugar and she actually 
charged us for it. The crew member who dropped the water was nowhere to be seen after it happened." In this 
representational photo, a Ryanair Boeing 737-800 aircraft lands at Barcelona's 'El Prat' airport, Sept. 28, 2018. 
Photo: Pau Barrena/AFP/Getty Images Although the couple had requested an ambulance at the tarmac whenthey 
landed, only the Scottish Fire and Rescue Service were available at the time. McNab was checked out by the 
paramedics who advised him to get admitted to a hospital without delay. He was treated for severe burns at the 
hospital."They submerged his feet in cold water and wrapped them in bandages, like they should have done on the 
plane," she said."I understand accidents happen, but the treatment by staff in the aftermath was shocking. It could 
easily have been a child or an elderly person. Luckily, Thomas is a big guy who was able to endure the pain and not 
make a fuss."A Ryanair spokesperson said their team had reached out to the customer in questionregarding the 
alleged incident and were 'looking for further information but has yet to receive a response. We will not be making 
further comment while the investigation continues.' [ 1]: https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/scottish-news/ryanair-
flight-horror-man-left-16247853 
Load-Date: June 4, 2019

Galibier Capital Management Ltd. Grows Position in Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY)
Galibier Capital Management Ltd. Grows Position in Ryanair Holdings plc 
(RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
June 3, 2019 Monday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 723 words
Body
Ryanair logo Galibier Capital Management Ltd. increased its holdings in  Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) 
by 12.3% during the first quarter, according to its most recent filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission 
(SEC). The institutional investor  owned 27,397 shares of the transportation company's stock after purchasing an 
additional 3,010 shares during the quarter. Ryanair accounts for  1.2% of Galibier Capital Management Ltd.'s 
holdings, making the stock its 17th biggest position. Galibier Capital Management Ltd.'s holdings in Ryanair were 
worth $2,053,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.  
Other hedge funds and other institutional investors have also added to or reduced their stakes in the company. 
BB&T Corp raised its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 7.3% in the 1st quarter. BB&T Corp now owns 4,419 shares 
of the transportation company's stock worth $331,000 after purchasing an additional 299 shares in the last quarter.  
Daiwa Securities Group Inc. raised its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 17.8% during the fourth quarter. Daiwa 
Securities Group Inc. now owns 40,212 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $2,869,000 after 
acquiring an additional 6,090 shares during the period.  Lafayette Investments Inc. raised its holdings in shares of  
Ryanair by 4.3% during the fourth quarter. Lafayette Investments Inc. now owns 62,850 shares of the transportation 
company's stock valued at $4,484,000 after acquiring an additional 2,595 shares during the period.  Brinker Capital 
Inc. raised its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 26.5% during the first quarter. Brinker Capital Inc. now owns 28,668 
shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $2,148,000 after acquiring an additional 6,009 shares during 
the period.  Finally, Two Sigma Investments LP acquired a new stake in shares of  Ryanair during the fourth quarter 
valued at approximately $4,195,000. Institutional investors and hedge funds own  43.06% of the company's stock.  
A number of equities research analysts have recently issued reports on RYAAY shares. BidaskClub lowered shares 
of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Wednesday, May 8th. HSBC lowered shares of 
Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating and set a $73.00 price target on the stock. in a report on Tuesday, 
April 2nd. Cantor Fitzgerald upgraded shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on 
Wednesday, February 6th. Raymond James cut their price target on shares of Ryanair from $85.00 to $80.00 and 
set an "outperform" rating on the stock in a report on Tuesday, May 21st. Finally, JPMorgan Chase & Co. lowered 
shares of Ryanair from an "overweight" rating to a "neutral" rating in a report on Tuesday, May 21st. Five equities 
research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five have given a hold rating and six have given a buy 
rating to the stock. Ryanair  has a consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus target price of $76.33. 
Galibier Capital Management Ltd. Grows Position in Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY)
Shares of RYAAY  opened at $65.22 on Monday. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 52 week low of $65.14 and a 52 week 
high of $120.86. The company has a market cap of $15.28 billion, a P/E ratio of 12.69 and a beta of 0.85. The 
company has a current ratio of 0.93, a quick ratio of 0.93 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.64.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, May 20th. The transportation 
company reported ($0.74) EPS for the quarter, missing the Zacks' consensus estimate of ($0.64) by ($0.10). 
Ryanair had a net margin of 11.69% and a return on equity of 20.34%. The company had revenue of $1.45 billion 
for the quarter.  On average, equities research analysts predict that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 4.55 EPS for the 
current year.  
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Shares Bought by Galibier Capital Management Ltd.
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Shares Bought by Galibier Capital 
Management Ltd.
DailyPolitical
June 3, 2019 Monday 2:06 PM EST
Copyright 2019 Newstex LLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 734 words
Body
Jun 03, 2019( DailyPolitical: http://www.dailypolitical.com/ Delivered by Newstex)  Galibier Capital Management Ltd. 
boosted its stake in shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 12.3% in the 1st quarter, Holdings 
Channel[1] reports. The firm owned 27,397 shares of the transportation company's stock after buying an additional 
3,010 shares during the quarter. 
Ryanair makes up 1.2% of Galibier Capital Management Ltd.'s holdings, making the stock its 17th largest holding. 
Galibier Capital Management Ltd.'s holdings in Ryanair were worth $2,053,000 as of its most recent filing with the 
Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Several other hedge funds have also made changes to their positions 
in RYAAY. Pinnacle Bank acquired a new position in shares of Ryanair in the 4th quarter valued at $31,000. 
BRITISH COLUMBIA INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT Corp bought a new stake in shares of Ryanair in the 4th 
quarter worth about $84,000. Quadrant Capital Group LLC grew its holdings in shares of Ryanair by 69.7% in the 
1st quarter. Quadrant Capital Group LLC now owns 1,583 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$116,000 after purchasing an additional 650 shares during the last quarter. US Bancorp DE grew its holdings in 
shares of Ryanair by 9.5% in the 1st quarter. US Bancorp DE now owns 1,700 shares of the transportation 
company's stock worth $127,000 after purchasing an additional 147 shares during the last quarter. Finally, 
Quantamental Technologies LLC bought a new stake in shares of Ryanair in the 1st quarter worth about $129,000.

Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Shares Bought by Raymond James & Associates
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Shares Bought by Raymond James & 
Associates
American Banking and Market News
June 2, 2019 Sunday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 674 words
Body
Ryanair logo Raymond James & Associates boosted its position in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 13.6% during the 1st quarter, according to the company in its most recent disclosure with the 
Securities & Exchange Commission. The firm owned 73,217 shares of the transportation company's stock after 
buying an additional 8,746 shares during the period. Raymond James & Associates' holdings in Ryanair were worth 
$5,487,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.  
A number of other institutional investors and hedge funds have also recently added to or reduced their stakes in 
RYAAY. Pinnacle Bank acquired a new position in shares of  Ryanair in the fourth quarter valued at approximately 
$31,000.  BRITISH COLUMBIA INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT Corp acquired a new position in shares of  Ryanair 
in the fourth quarter valued at approximately $84,000.  Quadrant Capital Group LLC increased its holdings in 
shares of  Ryanair by 69.7% in the first quarter. Quadrant Capital Group LLC now owns 1,583 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $116,000 after purchasing an additional 650 shares during the period.  
Quantamental Technologies LLC acquired a new position in shares of  Ryanair in the first quarter valued at 
approximately $129,000.  Finally, NumerixS Investment Technologies Inc increased its holdings in shares of  
Ryanair by 171.4% in the fourth quarter. NumerixS Investment Technologies Inc now owns 1,900 shares of the 
transportation company's stock valued at $136,000 after purchasing an additional 1,200 shares during the period. 
43.06% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors.  
A number of research firms have recently issued reports on RYAAY. BidaskClub raised Ryanair from a "sell" rating 
to a "hold" rating in a report on Tuesday, April 16th. HSBC lowered Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating 
and set a $73.00 target price on the stock. in a report on Tuesday, April 2nd. ValuEngine  raised Ryanair from a 
"strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Monday, April 1st. Societe Generale raised Ryanair from a "hold" 
rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Tuesday, February 19th. Finally, Cantor Fitzgerald raised Ryanair from a 
"hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Wednesday, February 6th. Five equities research analysts have rated 
the stock with a sell rating, five have assigned  a hold rating and six have issued  a buy rating to the company. The 
company  has a consensus rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $76.33. 
Shares of RYAAY stock  opened at $65.22 on Friday. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 1-year low of $65.14 and a 1-year 
high of $120.86. The firm has a market cap of $15.58 billion, a P/E ratio of 12.79 and a beta of 0.73. The company 
has a current ratio of 0.93, a quick ratio of 0.93 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.64.  
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Shares Bought by Raymond James & Associates
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its quarterly earnings data on Monday, May 20th. The transportation 
company reported ($0.74) earnings per share for the quarter, missing the Zacks' consensus estimate of ($0.64) by 
($0.10). Ryanair had a return on equity of 20.34% and a net margin of 11.69%. The business had revenue of $1.45 
billion for the quarter.  Equities analysts predict that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 4.55 EPS for the current fiscal 
year.   
About Ryanair
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair wins green light for Malta Air: reports
Ryanair wins green light for Malta Air: reports
AirFinance Journal
June 2019
Copyright 2019 Euromoney Institutional Investor PLC All Rights Reserved
Length: 110 words
Byline: Alex Derber
Body
Ryanair has completed negotiations with Malta's government to set up new subsidiary Malta Air on the island, 
Maltese media report.
The deal will see Irish carrier doubling its Malta-based fleet to 10 aircraft, while Malta's government will retain a 
golden share in the new airline, allowing it to veto any sale of Malta Air to a third party.
Malta Air will take over 61 Ryanair routes to and from the island, the Times of Malta reports.
Sources told the newspaper that Ryanair could be eyeing Malta as a connecting hub.
According to local media, the Maltese government believes that the new low-cost airline will not compete 
significantly with flag carrier Air Malta.
Load-Date: July 1, 2019
End of Document
Weekly Research Analysts' Ratings Changes for Ryanair ( RYAAY )
Weekly Research Analysts' Ratings Changes for Ryanair (RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
May 31, 2019 Friday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 660 words
Body
Ryanair logo Ryanair (NASDAQ: RYAAY) has recently received a number of price target changes and ratings 
updates: 
•
5/22/2019 - Ryanair  was downgraded by analysts at HSBC Holdings plc from a "hold" rating to a "reduce" 
rating.
•
5/21/2019 - Ryanair had its price target lowered by analysts at Raymond James from $85.00 to $80.00. 
They now have an "outperform" rating on the stock.
•
5/21/2019 - Ryanair  was downgraded by analysts at JPMorgan Chase & Co. from an "overweight" rating 
to a "neutral" rating.
•
5/18/2019 - Ryanair  was downgraded by analysts at BidaskClub from a "sell" rating to a "strong sell" 
rating.
•
5/8/2019 - Ryanair  was downgraded by analysts at BidaskClub from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating.
•
4/16/2019 - Ryanair  was upgraded by analysts at BidaskClub from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating.
•
4/2/2019 - Ryanair  was downgraded by analysts at HSBC Holdings plc from a "buy" rating to a "hold" 
rating. They now have a $73.00 price target on the stock.
•
4/1/2019 - Ryanair  was upgraded by analysts at ValuEngine  from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating.
Shares of RYAAY stock  opened at $66.50 on Friday. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.64, a current 
ratio of 0.93 and a quick ratio of 0.93. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 12-month low of $65.61 and a 12-month high of 
$120.86. The stock has a market cap of $15.61 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 12.94 and a beta of 0.73.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last released its earnings results on Monday, May 20th. The transportation company 
reported ($0.74) earnings per share for the quarter, missing analysts' consensus estimates of ($0.64) by ($0.10). 
Ryanair had a net margin of 11.69% and a return on equity of 20.34%. The company had revenue of $1.45 billion 
during the quarter.  Equities research analysts anticipate that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 4.55 earnings per 
share for the current fiscal year.

Associates L P raised its position in  Ryanair by 38.6% during the 4th quarter. Harris Associates L P now owns 
14,358,251 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $1,024,318,000 after purchasing an additional 
4,002,188 shares during the last quarter.  Baillie Gifford & Co. raised its position in  Ryanair by 15.7% during the 4th

quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 6,792,319 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$484,564,000 after purchasing an additional 920,644 shares during the last quarter.  Lazard Asset Management

6,533,662 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $489,632,000 after purchasing an additional

services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Receives Average Recommendation of "Hold" from Brokerages
Ryanair Holdings plc (RYAAY) Receives Average Recommendation of "Hold" 
from Brokerages
American Banking and Market News
May 30, 2019 Thursday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 575 words
Body
Ryanair logo Shares of Ryanair Holdings plc (NASDAQ:RYAAY) have earned an average recommendation of 
"Hold" from the seventeen analysts that are  covering the stock,            MarketBeat Ratings  reports. Five equities 
research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five have assigned  a hold rating and six have assigned  a 
buy rating to  the company. The average 1-year price target among brokers that have issued ratings on the stock in 
the last year is $78.00.  
RYAAY has been the topic of a number of recent analyst reports. Raymond James raised shares of Ryanair from a 
"market perform" rating to an "outperform" rating and set a $85.00 price objective on the stock in a research report 
on Wednesday, January 30th. They noted that the move was a valuation call. Cantor Fitzgerald raised shares of 
Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research report on Wednesday, February 6th. Societe Generale 
raised shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a research report on Tuesday, February 19th. 
BidaskClub raised shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a research report on Thursday, 
February 28th. Finally, ValuEngine  raised shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a 
research report on Monday, April 1st. 
Shares of NASDAQ RYAAY  opened at $66.65 on Thursday. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.64, a 
quick ratio of 0.93 and a current ratio of 0.93. The stock has a market cap of $16.35 billion, a PE ratio of 12.97 and 
a beta of 0.73. Ryanair has a 12-month low of $65.61 and a 12-month high of $120.86.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last announced its earnings results on Monday, May 20th. The transportation company 
reported ($0.74) earnings per share (EPS) for the quarter, missing the consensus estimate of ($0.64) by ($0.10). 
The business had revenue of $1.45 billion for the quarter. Ryanair had a net margin of 11.69% and a return on 
equity of 20.34%.  As a group, sell-side analysts expect that  Ryanair will post 4.55 EPS for the current year.  
A number of hedge funds have recently modified their holdings of RYAAY. Pinnacle Bank bought a new position in  
Ryanair in the 4th quarter worth about $31,000.  Coastal Investment Advisors Inc. bought a new position in  Ryanair 
in the 1st quarter worth about $55,000.  BRITISH COLUMBIA INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT Corp bought a new 
position in  Ryanair in the 4th quarter worth about $84,000.  Cresset Asset Management LLC bought a new position 
in  Ryanair in the 1st quarter worth about $102,000.  Finally, Quadrant Capital Group LLC grew its stake in  Ryanair 
by 69.7% in the 1st quarter. Quadrant Capital Group LLC now owns 1,583 shares of the transportation company's 
stock worth $116,000 after acquiring an additional 650 shares in the last quarter. Institutional investors and hedge 
funds own  43.06% of the company's stock.  
Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY ) Receives Average Recommendation of "Hold" from Brokerages
Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

TimesSquare Capital Management LLC Boosts Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
TimesSquare Capital Management LLC Boosts Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc 
(RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
May 30, 2019 Thursday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 801 words
Body
Ryanair logo TimesSquare Capital Management LLC lifted its stake in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 24.1% in the 1st quarter, according to its most recent disclosure with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission. The firm owned 1,000,500 shares of the transportation company's stock after buying an 
additional 194,500 shares during the period. TimesSquare Capital Management LLC owned approximately 0.43% 
of Ryanair worth $74,977,000 at the end of the most recent quarter.  
Several other large investors also recently bought and sold shares of the company. Harris Associates L P raised its 
holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 38.6% during the fourth quarter. Harris Associates L P now owns 14,358,251 
shares of the transportation company's stock worth $1,024,318,000 after purchasing an additional 4,002,188 shares 
during the last quarter.  Baillie Gifford & Co. raised its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 15.7% during the fourth 
quarter. Baillie Gifford & Co. now owns 6,792,319 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $484,564,000 
after purchasing an additional 920,644 shares during the last quarter.  Massachusetts Financial Services Co. MA 
raised its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 27.5% during the fourth quarter. Massachusetts Financial Services Co. 
MA now owns 3,458,575 shares of the transportation company's stock worth $246,734,000 after purchasing an 
additional 745,493 shares during the last quarter.  Metropolis Capital Ltd raised its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by

stock worth $59,055,000 after purchasing an additional 388,868 shares during the last quarter.  Finally, Thornburg 
Investment Management Inc. raised its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 14.8% during the first quarter. Thornburg 
Investment Management Inc. now owns 1,943,636 shares of the transportation company's stock worth 
$145,656,000 after purchasing an additional 251,125 shares during the last quarter. Institutional investors and 
hedge funds own  43.06% of the company's stock.  
A number of research analysts have weighed in on RYAAY shares. Raymond James raised shares of Ryanair from 
a "market perform" rating to an "outperform" rating and set a $85.00 price objective for the company in a report on 
Wednesday, January 30th. They noted that the move was a valuation call. Cantor Fitzgerald raised shares of 
Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Wednesday, February 6th. Societe Generale raised 
shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Tuesday, February 19th. BidaskClub raised 
shares of Ryanair from a "sell" rating to a "hold" rating in a report on Thursday, February 28th. Finally, ValuEngine  
raised shares of Ryanair from a "strong sell" rating to a "sell" rating in a report on Monday, April 1st. Five equities 
research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five have issued  a hold rating and six have assigned  a 
buy rating to the stock. Ryanair  has a consensus rating of "Hold" and a consensus target price of $76.33. 
TimesSquare Capital Management LLC Boosts Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )

compared to its average volume of 796,658. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.64, a current ratio of 0.93 
and a quick ratio of 0.93. The firm has a market capitalization of $15.93 billion, a price-to-earnings ratio of 12.99 
and a beta of 0.73. Ryanair Holdings plc has a 1-year low of $65.61 and a 1-year high of $120.86.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last posted its earnings results on Monday, May 20th. The transportation company 
reported ($0.74) earnings per share for the quarter, missing the consensus estimate of ($0.64) by ($0.10). The firm 
had revenue of $1.45 billion during the quarter. Ryanair had a net margin of 11.69% and a return on equity of 
20.34%.  As a group, equities analysts anticipate that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 4.55 earnings per share for the 
current fiscal year.   
Ryanair Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

European shares/Brexit: exchanges of fire Twitter : @FTLex
European shares/Brexit: exchanges of fire; Twitter: @FTLex
Financial Times (London, England)
May 30, 2019 Thursday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2019 The Financial Times Limited All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; Pg. 12
Length: 376 words
Body
Europe's stock market watchdog had wanted trading in top UK stocks by EU fund managers switched to EU venues 
in the event of a no-deal Brexit. But London is a far bigger market. The watchdog has backed down, but EU 
companies traded heavily in London could still be ensnared.
Hear a bugle sounding a retreat? The threat of a no-deal Brexit has put UK and EU stock market regulators on 
battle stations.
In March, the European Securities and Markets Authority warned that EU fund managers would have to use 
exchanges on the continent - rather than London venues - to trade 14 important London-listed stocks.
Yesterday, it admitted defeat and tore up the plan. That was positive for investors. They may still suffer collateral 
damage in a Brussels/London stand-off.
Esma's retreat recognised London's importance as a global market. EU asset managers wanted to trade there for 
deepest liquidity and best prices. They could have traded the 14 stocks on EU venues. The idea, however, of a 
German fund manager having to buy Vodafone shares in Berlin was silly.
The battle is not over. Esma still wants shares in selected companies from the remaining 27 EU countries traded on 
EU venues, even if they are listed in London or it is the most liquid market. IAG, the airline business registered in 
Spain, and Ireland's Ryanair would be ensnared.
European shares/Brexit: exchanges of fire Twitter : @FTLex
The UK's Financial Conduct Authority has not said how it might retaliate. One option would be to force UK asset 
managers to trade EU companies' shares only in London. That would hit EU venues - and further fragment 
European markets.
London regulators should hold fire.
Both sides are mutually dependent. EU companies benefit from being able to raise funds in the UK. London's 
openness boosts its international standing. Liquidity begets liquidity. An orderly Brexit might yet be possible, 
allowing a deal on share trading.
London would like an "equivalence" regime - EU recognition of its rules. That would be politically difficult for 
Brussels, implying EU benefits can be had without membership obligations.
Switzerland - outside the EU - may lose stock market equivalence if it does not sign up to new trading 
arrangements. Nevertheless, if Brexit happens, a peace deal that benefits shareholders would benefit the EU and 
London too.
Load-Date: May 29, 2019
End of Document

European shares/Brexit: exchanges of fire; Twitter: @FTLex

BEST OF THEBROKERS To appear in Best of the Brokers, email your research to notes@cityam.com
BEST OF THEBROKERS To appear in Best of the Brokers, email your 
research to notes@cityam.com
City A.M.
May 30, 2019 Thursday
Edition 1, National Edition
Copyright 2019 City A.M. All Rights Reserved
Section: NEWS; Pg. 17
Length: 275 words
Body
Things were looking up this month as Paypoint announced profit grew two per cent year-on-year, and Jefferies 
analysts think this gives investors a reason to cash in. The store payment company has seen shares rise nearly 40 
per cent already this year, and this could keep rising, with revenue expected to be the "key profit driver". But, they 
added, "we also increase full-year 2020 net debt to £15m, due to higher [costs] and HMRC bringing tax payments 
forward". Analysts gave Paypoint a target price of 1200p and a "Buy" rating.
Profit plummeted 30 per cent at budget carrier Ryanair when it last reported and shares have fallen 14 per cent this 
month, but this still does not give Liberum analysts grounds to think they will fall much further. "The airline industry 
faces numerous short-term headwinds," they said. But they added: "Ryanair's long-term fundamentals remain intact 
and attractive, with a low cost base, market leadership, a robust balance sheet and strong cash generation." They 
gave Ryanair, which is listed in London and Dublin, a "Buy" rating and a target price of 1250 cents.
Specialist retailer Topps Tiles' profit fell 20 per cent in the first half of the year, but it has not stopped Liberum 
analysts from predicting the firm will build its share price in the coming weeks. The UK's tile retail sector is "highly 
fragmented," they wrote, giving Topps the perfect opportunity to fulfil its ambition of becoming the market leader 
within the next five years. "Topps' entry into the UK commercial tile space doubles its total addressable market size 
to over £700m," they added. They gave Topps a target price of 95p and a "Buy" rating.

FINANCIAL TIMES SHARE SERVICE
Load-Date: May 28, 2019
Travel & Leisure

Gatwick drones disrupt EasyJet results Low-cost carrier cites chaos caused by unmanned air vehicles near 
London airport in December for first-half losses
Gatwick drones disrupt EasyJet results; Low-cost carrier cites chaos caused 
by unmanned air vehicles near London airport in December for first-half 
losses
Flight International
May 28, 2019
Copyright 2019 DVV Media International Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: AIR TRANSPORT
Length: 353 words
Body
Increased capacity and the drone chaos at London Gatwick airport in December are among the factors EasyJet is 
citing after its pre-tax loss for its first half ended 31 March rose to £272 million ($348 million) from £68 million for the 
same period a year ago.
The UK low-cost carrier’s chief executive Johan Lundgren said the performance in its traditional low season was “in 
line with expectations” and the airline has retained its full-year profit guidance.
Revenue rose 7.3% to £2.34 billion, as capacity growth and a foreign-exchange benefit outweighed the negative 
impacts of Easter’s timing, the implementation of new IFRS 15 accounting standards, and “annualisation of prior-
year benefits such as Monarch’s bankruptcy and Ryanair cancelling a large proportion of its winter 2017/18 
schedule in the UK”.
On a per-seat basis, revenue fell 6.3%, or 7.4% at constant currency, while headline cost per seat increased 3.9%, 
or 1.3% at constant currency. The airline points to fuel price rises, foreign-exchange effects, underlying cost 
inflation, investments in “resilience” and the impact of the drone episode at Gatwick in December.
These were mitigated by a cost programme and fleet upgauging, the Luton-based airline says.
Capacity was lifted some 15% in the six-month period, “principally due to the annualising of new operations in 
Berlin”, notes EasyJet. It grew existing network capacity by 7%. Load factor fell a percentage point to 90.1%, while 
passenger numbers rose 13% to 41.6 million.
The carrier says the rise in its headline loss reflects the increased volume of capacity as well as revenue and cost 
drivers and “EasyJet’s normal seasonality”. The airline makes the bulk of its profits over the second half of its 
financial year, which encompasses the key summer season, and pre-tax profit expectations for the full year remain 
unchanged.
Gatwick drones disrupt EasyJet results Low-cost carrier cites chaos caused by unmanned air vehicles near 
London airport in December for first-half losses
EasyJet’s capacity is to be upped 7% in the six-month period. Forward bookings in the third quarter are three 
percentage points behind last year, at 72%, and flat for the fourth quarter, at 34%.
New operations were launched in Berlin last year
Filip Singer/EPA-EFE/Shutterstock

Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.

Cargo conversion looms for Ryanair's oldest 737-800sFreighter future for Ryanair's oldest jets; Low-cost carrier 
has received "strong bids" from buyers who plan....
Cargo conversion looms for Ryanair's oldest 737-800sFreighter future for 
Ryanair's oldest jets; Low-cost carrier has received "strong bids" from 
buyers who plan conversion of single-aisles into cargo configuration
Flight International
May 28, 2019
Copyright 2019 DVV Media International Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: AIR TRANSPORT
Length: 339 words
Body
Ryanair is preparing to sell a batch of its 10 oldest Boeing 737-800s as part of its fleet renewal programme.
Speaking during a webcast analyst interview on 20 May, Ryanair chief executive Michael O’Leary said the carrier 
was “very close” to a $170 million deal covering the 737NGs, but did not specify who would buy the jets.
Ryanair has received the “strongest bids” from purchasers who plan to convert the narrowbodies into cargo format 
for the Chinese market. These buyers are seeking aircraft aged 15-18 years old and are prepared to pay “attractive 
prices” for them, he notes.
O’Leary expects that the jets will be delivered to their new owners by the end of March 2020, assuming that the 
airline’s first on-order 737 Max jets arrive as scheduled during winter 2019-2020.
Once the transaction is closed, Ryanair plans to move on to selling “smaller packages” of “slightly younger” 737-
800s, he says.
Cirium’s Fleets Analyzer shows that Ryanair has a fleet of 431 737-800s in service; the airline’s 10 oldest examples 
have an average age of 16.3 years. However, the most elderly aircraft in its fleet is a 20-year-old 737-700 (EI-SEV), 
which is used as a corporate shuttle.
O’Leary describes the current market for leased aircraft as being “slightly strange”, noting that Austrian subsidiary 
Laudamotion has been quoted “very high” prices for new Airbus aircraft as a result of the global Max grounding.
By contrast, Laudamotion is seeing “extraordinary” value in the lease market for second-hand jets. O’Leary notes 
that for the 23 aircraft the carrier has taken this summer on five-year operating leases, rates are “well below” 
$200,000 per month for aircraft aged seven to nine years old.
Cargo conversion looms for Ryanair's oldest 737-800sFreighter future for Ryanair's oldest jets; Low-cost carrier 
has received "strong bids" from buyers who plan....
O’Leary says Ryanair is “very keen” to grow Laudamotion if it can find “that kind of value” in the operating lease 
market. He says there has been dialogue with Boeing on potential new aircraft for the airline, but notes that full 
orderbooks have pushed up prices.
Budget airline intends initial 10-aircraft sale for around $170 million

Max grounding forces Irish carrier into deliveruy rejigMax grounding forces delay to delivery schedule until 
winter
Max grounding forces Irish carrier into deliveruy rejigMax grounding forces 
delay to delivery schedule until winter
Flight International
May 28, 2019
Copyright 2019 DVV Media International Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: AIR TRANSPORT
Length: 342 words
Body
Ryanair has delayed the delivery of its first five Boeing 737 Max jets to the winter 2019-2020 season, as a result of 
the worldwide grounding of the re-engined type.
But the budget carrier insists it has “utmost confidence” in the aircraft.
Ryanair has ordered up to 210 of the aircraft, which will be delivered in a high-density configuration featuring 197 
seats.
Its first five aircraft, due to arrive in summer, will be pushed back to November this year. Another 42 due over the 
winter season will be delivered over the summer of 2020.
Pre-delivery payments have been “frozen”, the carrier states, and it adds that it “expects” Boeing to cover lost 
profits. Ryanair is engaged in talks with the US airframer.
The airline says its revised delivery schedule depends on European Union Aviation Safety Agency approval.
Ryanair says the delayed deliveries means the airline will “not see any meaningful cost benefit” until its 2021 fiscal 
year. But it states that the aircraft will generate “significant” unit-cost savings for the next five years.

Lauda's drive to be an airline champion; Motorsport legend brought same indomitable winning mentality to 
carriers he created as he did to Grand Prix races
Lauda's drive to be an airline champion; Motorsport legend brought same 
indomitable winning mentality to carriers he created as he did to Grand Prix 
races
Flight International
May 28, 2019
Copyright 2019 DVV Media International Ltd. All Rights Reserved
Section: AIR TRANSPORT
Length: 560 words
Body
Austrian motorsport star Niki Lauda, who has died aged 70, will be remembered by the aviation industry not just for 
his racing achievements, but also for the airlines that bore his name and sought, over several tempestuous 
decades, to challenge the dominance of his nation’s flag-carrier – and ultimately Lufthansa in Vienna.
In his Formula 1 career, Lauda won the World Drivers’ Championship three times, in 1975, 1977 and 1984. The 
latter two wins came after he was seriously injured when his car burst into flames during the 1976 German Grand 
Prix at the Nurburgring.
He made his foray into aviation in 1979 when he founded Lauda Air, a leisure airline based in Vienna. After his last 
F1 win and retirement from racing in 1984, Lauda was able to focus more closely on the airline.
The carrier initially operated passenger charter services within Europe, and scheduled operations were licensed in 
1987. In the teeth of opposition from Austrian Airlines, Lauda Air obtained licences for international flights and 
would branch out into long-haul services to destinations such as Bangkok, Hong Kong and Sydney.
Lufthansa took a 26.5% stake in Lauda Air in 1993, but it was rival Austrian Airlines that would ultimately gain 
control of its neighbour carrier in 1997, with Lufthansa holding 20% and Lauda retaining 30%.
In 2000, Lauda resigned as chairman of the airline following a public spat with Austrian chief executives Herbert 
Bammer and Mario Rehulka over Lauda Air’s losses, as it struggled with high fuel prices and the strength of the US 
dollar.
A year later, Lauda ended his dispute with Austrian when he agreed to sell his remaining shares in Lauda Air to the 
flag carrier. The Lauda Air brand would ultimately disappear in 2012.
Lauda's drive to be an airline champion; Motorsport legend brought same indomitable winning mentality to 
carriers he created as he did to Grand Prix races
In 1993, Lauda started a new airline called Lauda Air Italy, which operated out of Milan. That carrier would 
ultimately be acquired by its Italian compatriot Livingston a decade later.
Lauda then created a new airline – Niki – in 2003, using assets from the Austrian arm of defunct German carrier Aer 
Lloyd.
Niki undertook a rapid expansion into European short-haul markets and Air Berlin secured a 24% stake, taking full 
control in 2011, although Lauda stayed on as a non-executive director of the German carrier.
protracted victory
Unfortunately Niki was caught up in the collapse of Air Berlin in 2017, but a protracted sale process eventually saw 
Lauda emerge as the victor, retaking possession of his former carrier, renaming it Laudamotion and establishing a 
Vienna base.
If that were not surprising enough, Ryanair went on to secure an initial 25% stake, taking full control earlier this 
year.
In the course of his business dealings Lauda never shied away from challenging the status quo.
“Running an airline is the most difficult job in the world,” Lauda told Flight Daily News in 2009. “Racing was more 
dangerous for my life.
“To have a real challenge when I stopped racing, which was a difficult life in another way, I founded an airline. 
Driving is easy if you do it right like [Jenson] Button. You win easily because you have the best car and make a lot 
of money. In aviation you never make a lot of money.”
Laudamotion
Niki brand was renamed Laudamotion when Formula 1 star regained control after collapse of Air Berlin
“Running an airline is
the most difficult job
in the world – racing
was more dangerous
for my life”
Niki Lauda

CONSUMER SERVICES SECTOR REVIEW: Airlines Struggle, Retail Recovers
CONSUMER SERVICES SECTOR REVIEW: Airlines Struggle, Retail Recovers
Live Briefs PRO Global Markets
May 24, 2019 Friday 7:40 AM EST
Copyright 2019 MT Newswires All Rights Reserved
Length: 708 words
Body
 News in the consumer services sector this week continued to highlight struggles in the travel sector, with Irish 
budget airline Ryanair reporting a significant fall in profit. 
Meanwhile, results from retailers Marks & Spencer and B&M European Value Retail showed improved 
performances in the retail sector, as both reported a profit jump.
Ryanair started the week posting a 41% drop in annual pretax profit to EUR948.1 million due to higher oil prices, up 
23% in the year, and lower fares in a competitive market. Group revenue, for the year to march 31, rose 6% to 
EUR7.69 billion.
Furthermore, the low-cost airline warned of "zero" visibility on its results beyond the next few months.
Ryanair was not the only struggling airline in a year which saw a number of EU airlines failing including Primera, 
Sky Works and WOW. Flybe was sold, while both Alitalia and Thomas Cook's airline are currently for sale.
With regards to the sale of its airline, travel operator Thomas Cook on Thursday confirmed receiving an offer from 
private equity firm Triton Partners for its Nordic operations.
The travel company's Nordic business comprises of its tour operator and airline in Norway, Sweden, Finland and 
Denmark.
Thomas Cook said it was evaluating the offer alongside its ongoing strategic review of its group airline. The group 
said it has so far received multiple bids for parts and the whole of the airline business.
Also on Thursday, Thomas Cook received less positive news, with Fitch, S&P and Moody's downgrading the stock 
on concerns of weak trading and further deterioration.
Meanwhile, retailers seemed to be having a better time. 
CONSUMER SERVICES SECTOR REVIEW: Airlines Struggle, Retail Recovers
On Wednesday, homeware, clothing and food retailer Marks & Spencer Group reported a moderate decline in 
revenue but double-digit profit growth in its recently-ended financial year to March.
M&S said pretax profit rose 27% to GBP84.6 million despite revenue falling 3.0% to GBP10.38 billion. This was 
achieved thanks to the ongoing transformation programme launched by the company with the aim of delivering cost 
savings and growing the business. 
On Thursday, discount homewares retailer B&M European Value Retail also reported a positive annual 
performance with both revenue and profit increasing on the prior year.
For the year ended March 30, B&M posted pretax profit up 8.7% to GBP249.4 million and revenue increased 17% 
to GBP3.48 billion. UK B&M store fascia revenue rose 8.7%, 0.7% on a like-for-like basis.
Furthermore, reflecting the positive results, B&M upped its total payout 5.7% to 7.6 pence.
Looking ahead, the company reported a "pleasing start" to the first quarter of financial 2020, with mid-single digit 
like-for-like growth in B&M UK fascia stores.
Meanwhile on Friday, struggling baby products retailer Mothercare also published improved results as the effects of 
its restructuring programme slashed costs by 29%. 
This resulted in Mothercare's pretax loss narrowing to GBP66.6 million for the year to March 30, compared to the 
GBP94.0 million loss reported the year earlier.
However, revenue also declined by 12% to GBP513.8 million from GBP580.6 million the year before, due to the 
chain's UK store closure programme. 
"We have achieved a huge amount this year, refinancing, restructuring and reorganising Mothercare to ensure a 
sustainable future for the business," said Chief Executive Mark Newton-Jones. "Whilst this major restructuring 
activity has resulted in significant headline losses for the year, the business is now on a sounder financial footing." 
Lastly, FTSE 250 stationery & books retailer WH Smith on Tuesday announced its chief executive's departure, as 
sales in the third quarter of the year improved significantly. 
After 15 years with WH Smith, six of which as CEO, Stephen Clarke will step down from the board at the end of 
October, as he plans to "take a break".
Carl Cowling, managing director of the company's High Street business, will take over the role of CEO from 
November 1.
On the same day, reflecting improvements in the retail sector, WH Smith reported a 15% sales increase, 1% on a 
like-for-like basis in the 11-week period from March 1 to May 18.
The company's Travel unit saw sales up 26% while the High Street business continued to experience struggles with 
sales down by 1%.
Load-Date: May 25, 2019
End of Document
George Kaiser Family Foundation Increases Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
George Kaiser Family Foundation Increases Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc 
(RYAAY)
American Banking and Market News
May 24, 2019 Friday
Copyright 2019 American Banking and Market News All Rights Reserved
Length: 727 words
Body
Ryanair logo George Kaiser Family Foundation increased its holdings in shares of  Ryanair Holdings plc 
(NASDAQ:RYAAY) by 30.5% during the 1st quarter, according to its most recent Form 13F filing with the Securities 
and Exchange Commission (SEC). The institutional investor  owned 21,216 shares of the transportation company's 
stock after acquiring an additional 4,961 shares during the period. Ryanair makes up   0.6% of George Kaiser 
Family Foundation's investment portfolio, making the stock its 11th largest holding. George Kaiser Family 
Foundation's holdings in Ryanair were worth $1,590,000 as of its most recent SEC filing.  
A number of other large investors have also bought and sold shares of the stock. Pinnacle Bank purchased a new 
position in  Ryanair in the fourth quarter worth about $31,000.  BRITISH COLUMBIA INVESTMENT 
MANAGEMENT Corp purchased a new position in shares of  Ryanair during the fourth quarter valued at 
approximately $84,000.  Quadrant Capital Group LLC raised its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 69.7% during the 
first quarter. Quadrant Capital Group LLC now owns 1,583 shares of the transportation company's stock valued at 
$116,000 after purchasing an additional 650 shares during the last quarter.  We Are One Seven LLC purchased a 
new position in shares of  Ryanair during the fourth quarter valued at approximately $116,000.  Finally, US Bancorp 
DE raised its holdings in shares of  Ryanair by 9.5% during the first quarter. US Bancorp DE now owns 1,700 
shares of the transportation company's stock valued at $127,000 after purchasing an additional 147 shares during 
the last quarter. 45.80% of the stock is currently owned by institutional investors and hedge funds.  
Several research analysts have recently weighed in on RYAAY shares. Cantor Fitzgerald raised shares of Ryanair 
from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Wednesday, February 6th. Societe Generale raised shares of 
Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "buy" rating in a report on Tuesday, February 19th. Raymond James raised shares 
of Ryanair from a "market perform" rating to an "outperform" rating and set a $85.00 price objective for the company 
in a report on Wednesday, January 30th. They noted that the move was a valuation call. BidaskClub lowered 
shares of Ryanair from a "hold" rating to a "sell" rating in a research report on Wednesday, May 8th. Finally, HSBC 
lowered shares of Ryanair from a "buy" rating to a "hold" rating and set a $73.00 target price for the company. in a 
research report on Tuesday, April 2nd. Five research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, five have 
assigned  a hold rating and six have given a buy rating to the company's stock. The company presently has a 
consensus rating of "Hold" and an average price target of $76.33. 
George Kaiser Family Foundation Increases Stake in Ryanair Holdings plc ( RYAAY )
Shares of NASDAQ:RYAAY  opened at $68.69 on Friday. The company has a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.64, a current 
ratio of 0.93 and a quick ratio of 0.91. Ryanair Holdings plc has a fifty-two week low of $65.61 and a fifty-two week 
high of $121.45. The firm has a market cap of $16.44 billion, a P/E ratio of 13.36 and a beta of 0.73.  
Ryanair (NASDAQ:RYAAY) last issued its earnings results on Monday, May 20th. The transportation company 
reported ($0.74) earnings per share for the quarter, missing the Zacks' consensus estimate of ($0.64) by ($0.10). 
The company had revenue of $1.45 billion for the quarter. Ryanair had a return on equity of 20.34% and a net 
margin of 11.69%.  Research analysts anticipate that  Ryanair Holdings plc will post 5.1 earnings per share for the 
current year.   
Ryanair Company Profile
Ryanair Holdings plc, together with its subsidiaries, provides scheduled-passenger airline services in Ireland, the 
United Kingdom, and Other European countries. The company is also involved in the provision of various ancillary 
services, such as non-flight scheduled services and Internet-related services; in-flight sale of beverages, food, and 
merchandise; and marketing accommodation services, holidays, car hire, and travel insurance through its Website.
